definition: meeting an old friend in a foreign place (idiom)
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
to meet again after a long period of separation

pinyin: ren2 sheng1 he2 chu4 bu4 xiang1 feng2

definition: a thousand cups of wine is not too much when best friends meet (idiom)/when you're with close friends, you can let your hair down
pinyin: jiu3 feng2 zhi1 ji3 qian1 bei1 shao3

definition: to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
mixed feelings of grief and joy
hearts linked as one, just as the proverbial rhinoceros communicates emotion telepathically through his single horn (idiom); fig. two hearts beat as one
pinyin: xin1 you3 ling2 xi1 yi1 dian3 tong1

definition: a stranger in a strange land (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: du2 zai4 yi4 xiang1 wei2 yi4 ke4

definition: to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
